bill.title: Vital Statistics; Reporting
bill.description: Coordinate the transfer of records from the county clerks and the county real property assessment divisions to the Department of Health for verification of death purposes. Effective July 1, 2099. (SD1)

history.action: (H) Referred to HLT, FIN, referral sheet 3
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by HLT on Tuesday, 02-02-10 10:00 AM in House conference room 329.

(H) The committees on HLT recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 7 Ayes: Representative(s) Yamane, Nishimoto, Bertram, Brower, Mizuno, Shimabukuro; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Finnegan; Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Belatti, Carroll.
(H) Reported from HLT (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 226-10) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to FIN.
(H) Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by FIN on Tuesday, 02-23-10 1:30PM in House conference room 308.

(H) The committees on FIN recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 15 Ayes: Representative(s) M. Oshiro, M. Lee, Aquino, Awana, Brower, Choy, Coffman, Har, Keith-Agaran, C. Lee, Sagum, Tokioka, Wooley, Yamashita; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Finnegan; Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Nishimoto, Ward.
(H) Reported from FIN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 596-10), recommending passage on Third Reading.
(H) Passed Third Reading with none voting no (0) and none excused (0). Transmitted to Senate.
(S) The committee(s) on HTH/TIA has scheduled a public hearing on 03-10-10 2:15PM in conference room 016.

(S) The committee(s) on HTH recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in HTH were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Ige, Green, Baker, Espero, Nishihara; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Hemmings.

(S) The committee(s) on TIA recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in TIA were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) English, Gabbard, Espero, Nishihara, Slom; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 0 Excused: none.
(S) Reported from HTH/TIA (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2823) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referral to WAM.
(S) Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
